alert.note: Alert for Cibola (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 26 at 5:59PM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Strong thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall that will lead to excessive runoff and possible arroyo and small stream flooding. * WHERE...A portion of west central New Mexico, including the following counties, Cibola and McKinley. * WHEN...Until 830 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 559 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Grants, Milan, McCartys, Skyline-Ganipa, San Fidel, San Mateo, Cubero, El Morro, San Rafael in Cibola County, Acomita Lake, North Acomita Village and Encinal. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 75 and 103. This includes the following recreation areas... Coal Mine Canyon Campground, Ojo Redondo Campground and Water Canyon Wildlife Area.
info.instruction: Arroyos, streams, and normally dry rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes. Water in arroyos can travel many miles and take hours to reach your location from upstream rain areas.
